paper_abstract: In the framework of supervisory control of timed discrete event systems (TDESs), a supervisor decides the set of events to be enabled to occur and the set of events to be forced to occur in order for a given specification to be satisfied. In this paper, we consider decentralized supervisory control of TDESs where enforcement decisions of local supervisors are fused by the AND rule or the OR rule. We derive existence conditions of a decentralized supervisor under these decision fusion rules.
paper_title: Decentralized Supervisory Control of Timed Discrete Event Systems
